value.title: Azure for the Data Engineer
value.excerpt: This learning path guides data engineers through the evolving benefits your organization gains with Azure cloud data platform technologies.

topItems.title: Understand the evolving world of data
topItems.excerpt: Discover how data systems and roles are evolving and explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions using sample business cases.

topItems.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
topItems.excerpt: Explore the broad array of Azure technologies that analyze text or images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data.

topItems.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.

value.title: Cloud-native security operations with Azure Sentinel
value.excerpt: This learning path describes basic architecture, core capabilities, and primary use cases of its products. You'll also learn about differences and Get familiar with Azure Sentinel, a cloud-native, security information and event management (SIEM) service.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure Sentinel and connect data sources

value.title: Deliver remote desktops and apps from Azure with Windows Virtual Desktop
value.excerpt: Windows Virtual Desktop on Microsoft Azure is a desktop and app virtualization service that runs on the cloud. Windows Virtual Desktop works across devices – including Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android – with full-featured apps that you can use to access remote desktops and apps.

topItems.title: Introduction to Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Windows Virtual Desktop to deliver remote desktop and remote app experiences in Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Prepare for Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to prepare for Windows Virtual Desktop - a cloud-based virtualization solution running on Microsoft Azure. Windows Virtual Desktop is an elastically scalable service to deliver remote desktop and remote app experiences - without having to manage the underlying server infrastructure. Review the prerequisites and tools provided by Microsoft get ready to provision your first Windows Virtual Desktop host pool.

topItems.title: Deploy Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to deploy Windows Virtual Desktop and customize the workspace for your users.

topItems.title: Optimize Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn the steps to optimize Windows Virtual Desktop, including how to take advantage of new storage, file management, and automated scaling options.

value.title: Deploy applications with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous delivery (CD) pipeline that automates the process of deploying your application.

topItems.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Design and create a realistic release pipeline that promotes changes to various testing and staging environments.

topItems.title: Manage database changes in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Use a release approval in Azure Pipelines to help coordinate database schema changes between developers and database administrators.

topItems.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run Selenium UI tests, a form of functional testing, in Azure Pipelines.

value.title: Develop IoT solutions with Azure IoT Central
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. The first unit creates the app, the second unit defines a device template for a refrigerated truck. Then, create a programming project, add code to simulate a truck, and communicate with your IoT Central app. The truck is monitored through a custom dashboard.

topItems.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. We build the IoT Central app from a downloaded JSON file, defining all the device capabilities. Source code is also downloaded for the device app. The focus of this module is on creating rules and actions, to respond to certain telemetry input. Rules and actions enable greater automation of an IoT Central system.

topItems.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to manage an IoT Central application programmatically using the REST API

topItems.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
topItems.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from your previously completed "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you controlled a refrigerated truck. Here, in this module, you add continuous data export to both Azure Blob storage and an event hub. You then build a Power BI app to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

value.title: Implement Microsoft identity – Associate
value.excerpt: The Microsoft identity platform is an evolution of the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) developer platform. It allows developers to build applications that sign in users, and access resources in both external applications such as Microsoft Office 365, the Azure portal, and thousands of other SaaS applications and internal resources, such as apps on your corporate network and intranet, along with any cloud apps developed by your own organization. Learn how to utilize Microsoft identity in your custom applications.

topItems.title: Getting Started with Microsoft Identity
topItems.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.

topItems.title: Application types in Microsoft identity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how developers can leverage Microsoft identity in different types of applications.

topItems.title: Permissions and Consent Framework
topItems.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.

topItems.title: Secure custom APIs with Microsoft Identity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to secure a web API with Microsoft identity and how to call it from another application.

value.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices
value.excerpt: The reliability of your systems, services and products has a direct impact on your success. Learn the modern operations principles and practices (and the Azure features that support them) that will help you achieve the level of reliability you need.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: An introduction
topItems.excerpt: Discover a map for navigating reliability challenges and sustainably achieving the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Monitoring
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use monitoring to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Incident response
topItems.excerpt: Learn the incident response fundamentals necessary to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Learning from failure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about post-incident reviews, a practice necessary to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

value.title: Virtualization - Sharing cloud resources
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Dive deeper into how the cloud works by understanding virtualization. How are computing power, memory, input and output, networking, and storage virtualized?

topItems.title: Share cloud resources
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Get an introduction to virtualization, one of the many technologies that power the cloud. Learn what virtualization is, its benefits, and how cloud resources are shared.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Virtualize computing power
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about how computing power is virtualized using virtual CPUs. Covers different types of CPU virtualization.

topItems.title: Virtualize memory
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how memory is virtualized to support cloud resources. Covers different types of memory mapping and related issues.

value.title: Ingest, prepare & transform using Azure Databricks & Data Factory | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Today's business managers depend heavily on reliable data integration systems that run complex ETL/ELT workflows (extract, transform/load and load/transform data). Gaurav Malhotra joins Scott Hanselman to discuss how you can iteratively build, debug, deploy, and monitor your data integration workflows

value.title: Is Azure Free Account really free? | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this video of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to use Microsoft Azure for free, for 12 months.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips  Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft Azure: http://azure.com/free

value.title: Architect API integration in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect API integration in Azure, and provide secure, scalable API access for your applications.

topItems.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn about using an Azure API gateway to share APIs with partners, and how to use subscription keys to control access to your APIs.

topItems.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure API Management to change an API without rewriting code to enable you to apply a caching policy to a GET operation for quicker response.

topItems.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Protect your back-end APIs from information exposure and implement throttling to prevent resource exhaustion with policies in Azure API Management.

topItems.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to protect your APIs from unauthorized use with API keys and client certificate authentication.
